Indicator Name: Time spent in domestic work, female (hours)
Long definition: Time spent in domestic work, female refers to average hours per day that women ages 20-74 spent on housework, child and adult care, gardening and pet care, construction and repairs, shopping and services, and household management. Data are reported in number of hours, where decimals represent hundredths of an hour (e.g, 1.75 should be read 1 hour and 45 minutes; 0.20 should be read 12 minutes).
Source: United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE) Statistical Database.

Indicator Name: Time spent in domestic work, male (hours)
Long definition: Time spent in domestic work, male refers to average hours per day that men ages 20-74 spent on housework, child and adult care, gardening and pet care, construction and repairs, shopping and services, and household management. Data are reported in number of hours, where decimals represent hundredths of an hour (e.g, 1.75 should be read 1 hour and 45 minutes; 0.20 should be read 12 minutes).
Source: United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE) Statistical Database.

Indicator Name: Children in employment, male (% of male children ages 7-14)
Long definition: Children in employment refer to children involved in economic activity for at least one hour in the reference week of the survey.
Source: Understanding Children's Work project based on data from ILO, UNICEF and the World Bank.

Indicator Name: Children in employment, female (% of female children ages 7-14)
Long definition: Children in employment refer to children involved in economic activity for at least one hour in the reference week of the survey.
Source: Understanding Children's Work project based on data from ILO, UNICEF and the World Bank.

Indicator Name: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24, female (%) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 is the proportion of the population ages 15-24 that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24, female (%) (national estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 is the proportion of the population ages 15-24 that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24, male (%) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 is the proportion of the population ages 15-24 that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24, male (%) (national estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 is the proportion of the population ages 15-24 that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force participation rate, female (% of female population ages 15+) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force participation rate, female (% of female population ages 15+) (national estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force participation rate, male (% of male population ages 15+) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force participation rate, male (% of male population ages 15+) (national estimate)
Long definition: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force with advanced education, female (% of female working-age population with advanced education)
Long definition: The percentage of the working age population with an advanced level of education who are in the labor force. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force with advanced education, male (% of male working-age population with advanced education)
Long definition: The percentage of the working age population with an advanced level of education who are in the labor force. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force with basic education, female (% of female working-age population with basic education)
Long definition: The percentage of the working age population with a basic level of education who are in the labor force. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force with basic education, male (% of male working-age population with basic education)
Long definition: The percentage of the working age population with a basic level of education who are in the labor force. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force with intermediate education, female (% of female working-age population with intermediate education)
Long definition: The percentage of the working age population with an intermediate level of education who are in the labor force. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force with intermediate education, male (% of male working-age population with intermediate education)
Long definition: The percentage of the working age population with an intermediate level of education who are in the labor force. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Labor force, total
Long definition: Labor force comprises people ages 15 and older who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period. It includes people who are currently employed and people who are unemployed but seeking work as well as first-time job-seekers. Not everyone who works is included, however. Unpaid workers, family workers, and students are often omitted, and some countries do not count members of the armed forces. Labor force size tends to vary during the year as seasonal workers enter and leave.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database, using World Bank population estimates. Labor data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Time-related underemployment, female (% of employment)
Long definition: Time-related underemployment refers to all persons in employment who (i) wanted to work additional hours, (ii) had worked less than a specified hours threshold (working time in all jobs), and (iii) were available to work additional hours given an opportunity for more work.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Time-related underemployment, male (% of employment)
Long definition: Time-related underemployment refers to all persons in employment who (i) wanted to work additional hours, (ii) had worked less than a specified hours threshold (working time in all jobs), and (iii) were available to work additional hours given an opportunity for more work.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment with advanced education, female (% of female labor force with advanced education)
Long definition: The percentage of the labor force with an advanced level of education who are unemployed. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment with advanced education, male (% of male labor force with advanced education)
Long definition: The percentage of the labor force with an advanced level of education who are unemployed. Advanced education comprises short-cycle tertiary education, a bachelor’s degree or equivalent education level, a master’s degree or equivalent education level, or doctoral degree or equivalent education level according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment with basic education, female (% of female labor force with basic education)
Long definition: The percentage of the labor force with a basic level of education who are unemployed. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment with basic education, male (% of male labor force with basic education)
Long definition: The percentage of the labor force with a basic level of education who are unemployed. Basic education comprises primary education or lower secondary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment with intermediate education, female (% of female labor force with intermediate education)
Long definition: The percentage of the labor force with an intermediate level of education who are unemployed. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment with intermediate education, male (% of male labor force with intermediate education)
Long definition: The percentage of the labor force with an intermediate level of education who are unemployed. Intermediate education comprises upper secondary or post-secondary non tertiary education according to the International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011).
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment, female (% of female labor force) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment, female (% of female labor force) (national estimate)
Long definition: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment, male (% of male labor force) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment, male (% of male labor force) (national estimate)
Long definition: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment, youth female (% of female labor force ages 15-24) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Youth unemployment refers to the share of the labor force ages 15-24 without work but available for and seeking employment.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment, youth female (% of female labor force ages 15-24) (national estimate)
Long definition: Youth unemployment refers to the share of the labor force ages 15-24 without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment, youth male (% of male labor force ages 15-24) (modeled ILO estimate)
Long definition: Youth unemployment refers to the share of the labor force ages 15-24 without work but available for and seeking employment.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.

Indicator Name: Unemployment, youth male (% of male labor force ages 15-24) (national estimate)
Long definition: Youth unemployment refers to the share of the labor force ages 15-24 without work but available for and seeking employment. Definitions of labor force and unemployment differ by country.
Source: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in March 2017.
